content.webTitle: Call for tougher curbs on freed sex offenders

fields.headline: Call for tougher curbs on freed sex offenders
fields.bodyText: Tougher restrictions on sex offenders living in the community after release from prison were demanded yesterday by the children's charity NSPCC. Police and probation officers concentrated on monitoring the highest-risk offenders, but paid little attention to the rest, Wes Kewell, its director of children's services,told BBC Radio 5 Live. The probation union Napo said the charity's proposal would require a big increase in staff to monitor an extra 20,000 offenders in England and Wales, costing about £25m a year. An annual government report on monitoring sex offenders is due out today.
